page.title: 19Penshurst Place
page.content: {Penshurst Place}is one of Britain's outstanding stately homes. It is privately owned by Viscount De L'Isle whose family are the 18th successive Sidney family to make their home here. The Great Baron's Hall is part of the original Medieval Manor. The architecture also shows examples of Gothic and Elizabethan styles. This English Country House boasts some very famous residents including Henry VIII and Sir Philip Sidney. The house was given to the Sidney family by Edward VI in 1552, and contains fine collections of early portraits and tapestries as well as many pieces of beautifully preserved furniture. Surrounding the house are lovely gardens, green avenues of tall trees and acres of farmland.
